page.title: 15SUPERNATURAL
page.content: Most ghost stories in Port Glasgow are centred round Newark{Castle,}one of the oldest buildings in the town. This has a 'menagerie of spooks' and white ladies. Another story is that of the "Bogle Stane" a large piece of granite in the Port which people say the druids danced about worshiping their heathen gods. Maybe the most famous {supernatural}story of Port Glasgow is that of the Highland warrior, Wallace. He, it was said, was chased by the English to a tree which is now in Holy Family church grounds, and was speared to death with arrows. You can still see today the shackles on the tree that held him as he died. And every year on his anniversary it is said you can hear the brave Scotsman die.
